alert.note: Alert for Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:23PM CDT until August 04 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LOUDON...SOUTH CENTRAL ANDERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN KNOX COUNTIES... At 623 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Farragut, or 10 miles southeast of Oak Ridge, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Farragut, Louisville, Bearden, Powell and Karns. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 368 and 394. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 83 and 112. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
